fields.summary: Document the ever-increasing list of options that can be set via euca-modify-property

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2011-12-12 13:12:04

Mon Dec 12 05:12:03 2011: Request 5115 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by scot.marvin
       Queue: Documentation
     Subject: Document the ever-increasing list of options that can be set via
 euca-modify-property
       Owner: Nobody
  Requestors: scot.marvin@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5115 >

Originally posted on 2011-12-26 19:02:48

Mon Dec 26 11:02:48 2011: Request 5115 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Given to scot.marvin by neil
       Queue: Documentation
     Subject: Document the ever-increasing list of options that can be set via euca-modify-property 
       Owner: scot.marvin
  Requestors: scot.marvin@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5115 >


This transaction appears to have no content

Originally posted on 2012-01-11 21:58:17
Documented in the Admin guide, under admin commands in the appendix.

Originally posted on 2012-01-11 21:58:18 by admin
https://support-test.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5115 This is a
comment. It is not sent to the Requestor(s): Documented in the Admin guide,
under admin commands in the appendix.

Documentation for all the options that can be modified by euca-modify-property are not listed in the appendix of the Admin guide.  

It would be really helpful to have a list of all the cloud properties available that can be modified via euca-modify-property, with each having a short description of what each property does.
Changed this from a "task" to a "bug" because it was stated that this was documented in the Admin Guide, and it isn't there.
Add option to the tool that lets it print out descriptions.  Then also Doc all these options.
Needed to get this back into open state so it hit the right filters. Basically just ignore this.

Hope this helps.  Here is a clean-up'd "euca-describe-properties --debug":

{code}
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>authentication.ldap_integration_configuration</euca:name>
		<euca:description>LDAP integration configuration, in JSON</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>authentication.websession_life_in_minutes</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Web session lifetime in minutes</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.hosts.state_initialize_timeout</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Timeout for state initialization (in msec).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.hosts.state_transfer_timeout</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Timeout for state transfers (in msec).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.batch_delay_seconds</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Interval (in seconds) during which a notification will be delayed to allow for batching events for delivery.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.digest</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Send a system state digest periodically.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.digest_frequency_hours</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Period (in hours) with which a system state digest will be delivered.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.digest_only_on_errors</euca:name>
		<euca:description>If sending system state digests is set to true, then only send the digest when the system has failures to report.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.email_from</euca:name>
		<euca:description>From email address used for notification delivery.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.email_from_name</euca:name>
		<euca:description>From email name used for notification delivery.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.email_subject_prefix</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Email subject used for notification delivery.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.email_to</euca:name><euca:value/>
		<euca:description>Email address where notifications are to be delivered.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.include_fault_stack</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Period (in hours) with which a system state digest will be delivered.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.email.email_smtp_host</euca:name><euca:value/>
		<euca:description>SMTP host to use when sending email.  If unset, the following values are tried: 1) the value of the 'mail.smtp.host' system property, 2) localhost, 3) mailhost.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.notifications.email.email_smtp_port</euca:name>
		<euca:description>SMTP port to use when sending email.  Defaults to 25</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.servicebus.hup</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Do a soft reset.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.servicebus.max_outstanding_messages</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Max queue length allowed per service stage.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.servicebus.workers_per_stage</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Max queue length allowed per service stage.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.timer.rate</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Amount of time (in milliseconds) before a previously running instance which is not reported will be marked as terminated.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.topology.coordinator_check_backoff_secs</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Backoff between service state checks (in seconds).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.topology.local_check_backoff_secs</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Backoff between service state checks (in seconds).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.tx.concurrent_update_retries</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum number of times a transaction may be retried before giving up.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.async_internal_operations</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Execute internal service operations from a separate thread pool (with respect to I/O).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.async_operations</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Execute service operations from a separate thread pool (with respect to I/O).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.async_pipeline</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Execute service specific pipeline handlers from a separate thread pool (with respect to I/O).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.channel_connect_timeout</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Channel connect timeout (ms).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.channel_keep_alive</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Socket keep alive.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.channel_nodelay</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server socket TCP_NODELAY.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.channel_reuse_address</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Socket reuse address.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.client_http_chunk_buffer_max</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server http chunk max.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.client_idle_timeout_secs</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Client idle timeout (secs).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.client_internal_timeout_secs</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Client idle timeout (secs).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.client_pool_max_mem_per_conn</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server worker thread pool max.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.client_pool_max_threads</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server worker thread pool max.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.client_pool_timeout_millis</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Client socket select timeout (ms).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.client_pool_total_mem</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server worker thread pool max.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.clock_skew_sec</euca:name>
		<euca:description>A max clock skew value (in seconds) between client and server accepted when validating timestamps in Query/REST protocol.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.cluster_connect_timeout_millis</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Cluster connect timeout (ms).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.default_aws_sns_uri_scheme</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default scheme for AWS_SNS_URL in eucarc.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.default_ec2_uri_scheme</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default scheme for EC2_URL in eucarc.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.default_euare_uri_scheme</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default scheme for EUARE_URL in eucarc.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.default_eustore_url</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default EUSTORE_URL in eucarc.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.default_https_enabled</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default scheme prefix in eucarc.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.default_s3_uri_scheme</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default scheme for S3_URL in eucarc.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.http_max_chunk_bytes</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum HTTP chunk size (bytes).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.http_max_header_bytes</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum HTTP headers size (bytes).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.http_max_initial_line_bytes</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum HTTP initial line size (bytes).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.oob_internal_operations</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Execute internal service operations out of band from the normal service bus.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.pipeline_read_timeout_seconds</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server socket read time-out.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.pipeline_write_timeout_seconds</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server socket write time-out.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.port</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Port to bind (note: port 8773 is always bound regardless).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.replay_skew_window_sec</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Time interval duration (in seconds) during which duplicate signatures will be accepted to accomodate collisions for legitimate requests inherent in Query/REST signing protocol.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_boss_pool_max_mem_per_conn</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server max selector memory per connection.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_boss_pool_max_threads</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server selector thread pool max.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_boss_pool_timeout_millis</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Service socket select timeout (ms).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_boss_pool_total_mem</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server worker thread pool max.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_channel_nodelay</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server socket TCP_NODELAY.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_channel_reuse_address</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server socket reuse address.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_pool_max_mem_per_conn</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server max worker memory per connection.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_pool_max_threads</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server worker thread pool max.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_pool_timeout_millis</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Service socket select timeout (ms).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.server_pool_total_mem</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Server max worker memory total.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.statistics</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Record and report service times.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Use DNS delegation for eucarc.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Use DNS names for instances.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.ssl.server_alias</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Alias of the certificate entry in euca.p12 to use for SSL for webservices.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.ssl.server_password</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Password of the private key corresponding to the specified certificate for SSL for webservices.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>bootstrap.webservices.ssl.server_ssl_ciphers</euca:name>
		<euca:description>SSL ciphers for webservices.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.addresses.dodynamicpublicaddresses</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Public addresses are assigned to instances by the system as available.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.addresses.maxkillorphans</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Number of times an orphaned address is reported by a cluster before it is reclaimed by the system.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.addresses.orphangrace</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Time after the last recorded state change where an orphaned address will not be modified by the system (minutes).</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.addresses.systemreservedpublicaddresses</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Public addresses are assigned to instances by the system only from a pool of reserved instances whose size is determined by this value.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.cluster.disabledinterval</euca:name>
		<euca:description>The time period between service state checks for a Cluster Controller which is DISABLED.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.cluster.enabledinterval</euca:name>
		<euca:description>The time period between service state checks for a Cluster Controller which is ENABLED.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.cluster.notreadyinterval</euca:name>
		<euca:description>The time period between service state checks for a Cluster Controller which is NOTREADY.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.cluster.pendinginterval</euca:name>
		<euca:description>The time period between service state checks for a Cluster Controller which is PENDING.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.cluster.requestworkers</euca:name>
		<euca:description>The number of concurrent requests which will be sent to a single Cluster Controller.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.cluster.startupsyncretries</euca:name>
		<euca:description>The number of times a request will be retried while bootstrapping a Cluster Controller.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.images.defaultkernelid</euca:name><euca:value/>
		<euca:description>The default used for running images which do not have a kernel specified in either the manifest, at register time, or at run-instances time.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.images.defaultramdiskid</euca:name><euca:value/>
		<euca:description>The default used for running images which do not have a ramdisk specified in either the manifest, at register time, or at run-instances time.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.images.defaultvisibility</euca:name>
		<euca:description>The default value used to determine whether or not images are marked 'public' when first registered.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.network.global_max_network_index</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default max network index.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.network.global_max_network_tag</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default max vlan tag.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.network.global_min_network_index</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default min network index.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.network.global_min_network_tag</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Default min vlan tag.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.network.network_index_pending_timeout</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Minutes before a pending index allocation timesout and is released.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.ebs_volume_creation_timeout</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Amount of time (in minutes) before a EBS volume backing the instance is created</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.instance_subdomain</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Subdomain to use for instance DNS.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.instance_timeout</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Amount of time (in minutes) before a previously running instance which is not reported will be marked as terminated.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.mac_prefix</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Prefix to use for instance MAC addresses.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.max_state_threads</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum number of threads the system will use to service blocking state changes.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.network_metadata_refresh_time</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum amount of time (in seconds) that the network topology service takes to propagate state changes.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.shut_down_time</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Amount of time (in minutes) before a VM which is not reported by a cluster will be marked as terminated.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.stopping_time</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Amount of time (in minutes) before a stopping VM which is not reported by a cluster will be marked as terminated.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.terminated_time</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Amount of time (in minutes) that a terminated VM will continue to be reported.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.tx_retries</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Number of times to retry transactions in the face of potential concurrent update conflicts.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.volatile_state_interval_sec</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Period (in seconds) between state updates for actively changing state.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>cloud.vmstate.volatile_state_timeout_sec</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Timeout (in seconds) before a requested instance terminate will be repeated.</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>enter-the-wu.cluster.addressespernetwork</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Number of total addresses per network (including unusable gateway addresses controlled by the system)</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>enter-the-wu.cluster.maxnetworkindex</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum usable network index (0 < x < max_network_index)</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>enter-the-wu.cluster.maxnetworktag</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum vlan tag to use (0 < min_vlan < x < 4096)</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>
	<euca:name>enter-the-wu.cluster.minnetworkindex</euca:name>
		<euca:description>Maximum usable network index (0 < min_network_index < x)</euca:description>
</euca:item>
<euca:item>

Its good that we have the options with a small description.  The next step would be to discuss the following:

* which properties can be changed via euca-modify-property
* what are the effects of changing a given property when
    ** instances (no instances) are running
    ** volumes (no volumes) are created
    ** images (no images) registered
    ** snapshots (no snapshots) are created
* best practices around changing cloud properties - performance, maintenance, etc.

Hey [~smarvin],

Something else that I think we should probably add to this is to know which cloud properties need a value versus which ones can be optionally set ( i.e. left to be <unset> ).  What do you think?

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Punting to 3.4 after discussion with Aaron. We have a complete list of properties and descriptions, but we will need default and valid values and some creamy delicious contextual nougat around this stuff before it goes out in the docs.
Hey [~scottb]/[~smarvin], will this make it in the 3.4.0 docs?
Need to open tickets for specific options. Otherwise, this issue will never be complete.
